explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to HSDB (2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2261 Xylenol (solid)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures (flash point: 599degC (ICSC, 2004))

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 25.4-26degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2261 Xylenol (solid)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,300mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 3,200mg/kg (RTECS (2006)) and 2,300mg/kg (HSDB (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 1,040mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" or "solid"according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2003) of the human health effects: "Corrosive to the skin, respiratory tract and eye." Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2003) of the human health effects: "Corrosive to the skin, respiratory tract and eye."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2003): "Repeated or prolonged contact may cause a skin sensitization reaction."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity tests and no positive data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (several indices), described in NTP DB (Access on June 2006).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Corrosive to the skin, respiratory tract and eye; oral ingestion results in corrosion; inhalation of aerosols may lead to pulmonary edema (ICSC (J) (2003)). Since the priority rating of the referenced study is 2, these effects are classified into Category 2 (respiratory organs).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "at final sacrifice in the mid-dose female group, BUN levels were significantly higher than controls," "lethargy, prostration and ataxia in males and females" (IRIS (1990)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=4.2mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 91% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=2.3 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
